For anyone having trouble with the eps being too dark, most players have brightness and contrast controls, if you look for them.  For Windows Media Player you just right click on the 'screen' and mouse over 'Enhancements' and then click on 'Video settings'.  In VLC, click on the 'Show Extended Settings' button (looks like a little 3-slider equalizer) and then click on the 'Video Effects' tab and the 'Basic' sub-tab.  [The Synchronization tab is where you can match the audio to the video if you have a problem there, just FYI.]
I have to do this on everything I watch since my CRT has been darkening for the past year or so as it slowly dies...
